title: Ethics ◉ Data Science
text:
Data science for non-data scientists




What is data science?


Data science skills


Math and statistics knowledge


Substantive expertise





Preparatory work

Problem definition predict, infer, describe
Design conceptualize, build data collection device
Data collection recruit, collect, monitor



Data wrangling

Wrangle: import, tidy, manipulate
Explore: visualize, describe, discover
Model: build, test, infer, predict



Dissemination

Communicate: to the public, media, policymakers
Publish: journals/proceedings, blogs, software
Productize: make usable, robust, scalable



Meta skill: programming

title: Ethics ◉ Data Science
text:
About
This website is the result of a cooperation between the Maxwell School at Syracuse University and the Hertie School, Berlin. The teaching ideas resulted from discussions, ideation, and prototyping during a workshop in Berlin in August 2021. They were developed into their current form by Simon Munzert and Johannes Himmelreich. This project was made possible with funding from the Association of Professional Schools of International Affairs (APSIA).

title: Ethics ◉ Data Science
text:
Instructor material
Are you instructor of a data science course looking for materials for a session on ethics of data science? Or are you an instructor of a data science ethics course looking for materials for a session on data science in practice? Check out our instructor notes!
